clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome of Bariatric Surgery in Patients With BMI Greater Than 60 .
clinical_study.official_title: Is Bariatric Surgery Effective in Super-super Morbid Obese Patients?

brief_summary.textblock: Patients that underwent any type of bariatric surgery with BMI more than 60 will recruited for follow up that includes: actual weight, other surgeries and conversions, co-morbidities status, medications and satisfaction.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients that underwent bariatric surgery for BMI =60 or greater were considered for the study. The type of surgery were be analyze related to weight loss. Complication and operation difficulty will be assessed.
Co morbidities and treatment results post surgery will be considered as also, need for revisional surgery/

primary_outcome.description: change in bodyweight following the surgery (kg)
prevalence of diseases linked to obesity (hypertension, diabetes, sleep apnea)

arm_group.description: Outcome of patients that underwent sleeve gastrectomy with BMI greater than 60.
Outcome of patients that underwent gastric bypass with BMI greater than 60.
Outcome of patients that underwent gastric banding with BMI greater than 60.

study_pop.textblock: Patients accepted to underwent bariatric surgery with BMI equal or above 60
